item.title: Copy a slice in Go
item.description: To duplicate a slice in Go, getting a deep copy of its contents, you need to either use the built-in copy() function, or create a new empty slice and add all the elements of the first slice to it using the append() function. item.title: The Go runtime scheduler's clever way of dealing with system calls
item.description: The Go runtime scheduler’s clever way of dealing with system calls One of Go’s signature features is goroutines, which are lightweight threads that are managed by the Go runtime. The Go runtime implements goroutines using a M:N work stealing scheduler to multiplex goroutines on to operating system threads.
